author: funnygiulio
content: I have a question about status codes, does the beacon chain does anything with them?

author: m.kalinin
content: you mean error codes in Engine API?

author: m.kalinin
content: Ah, these ones. `INVALID` invalidates the beacon block, `VALID` is valid and means that the block is accepted if the beacon chain state transition says so as well, `SYNCING` turns beacon node into syncing mode, this mode has a lot of implications, validator can't attest and propose while syncing, all beacon blocks are optimistically processed while EL is syncing and aren't surfaced to both, user and other beacon nodes, until they are fully validated -- when the first `VALID` response is returned. `INVALID` may also invalidate a segment of a chain if `latestValidHash`  points to ancestor that is far from the head of this chain

author: okyne
content: Hey guys, has any decision been made with respect to the ETH1_FOLLOW_DISTANCE ? I would assume a 2048 block period would no longer be needed before recognising validator deposits as final and that instead we could lean on finalised head for when a deposit is recognised and pushed to the activation queue? Is that accurate? Is such a change out of scope for a minimal viable merge?

author: m.kalinin
content: It's out of scope for the minimal merge and considered for a clean up fork. The end design is not yet settled down and using finality is one of the potential ways. Ideally, the proposer of the next block includes deposits made in the previous block with proofs linked to `ExecutionPayload.state_root` or even beacon block/state root but it would require beacon chain to verify hexary trie proofs which isn't desired dependency.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Personally I prefer having an explicit `engine_getBlock` RPC (plus any other required RPCs) than exposing all of `eth_` on the EL<=>CL channel, I feel like exposing the entire `eth` namespace adds a lot of surface area to the interface.  At a minimum I think the spec should enumerate which `eth` methods are needed by the CL.
